text:
Emerging Mathematical Ideas

Begin to develop an algorithm for dividing any two rational numbers, connecting to number lines, and/or patterns (fact families).

  • When the numbers are either both positive or both negative—divide the numbers and the sign for the quotient is positive.
  • When one factor is positive and one factor is negative—divide the numbers and the sign for the quotient is negative.
  • When multiplying a number by its inverse, the product is one and the sign of the numbers is based on the signs of the factors

Explore the relationship been multiplication and division and how division is the inverse operation of multiplication. Connect to the multiplicative inverse property.

NWDYK

Describe an algorithm for dividing rational numbers. Describe how multiplication and division are related.
